00063 /*---- definitions -------------------------------------------------*/
00064 
00065 /* LOCAL/EXPERIMENTAL use, see devices.txt */
00066 #define HYT1331_MAJOR         60
00067 
00068 #include "khyt1331.h"
00069 
00070 #define OUTP(_p, _d) outb(_d, _p)
00071 #define OUTPW(_p, _d) outw(_d, _p)
00072 #define OUTP_P(_p, _d) outb_p(_d, _p)
00073 #define INP(_p) inb(_p)
00074 #define INPW(_p) inw(_p)
00075 
00076 /*---- globals -----------------------------------------------------*/
00077 
00078 int io_base = 0, irq = 0;
00079 
00080 spinlock_t khyt1331_lock;       /* spin lock for busy check */
00081 int khyt1331_in_use = 0;        /* flag if device in use */
00082 int in_use_pid;                 /* PID of process which uses device */
00083 int interrupt_info;             /* crate/station which caused interrupt */
00084 int interrupt_count;
00085 
00086 DECLARE_WAIT_QUEUE_HEAD(wq);
00087 struct fasync_struct *async_queue;

00091 /*---- open --------------------------------------------------------*/
00092 
00093 static int khyt1331_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00094 {
00095    unsigned int minor;
00096 
00097    minor = MINOR(inode->i_rdev);
00098    printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: open called by PID %u, on minor %d\n", current->pid,
00099           minor);
00100 
00101    spin_lock_irq(&khyt1331_lock);
00102 
00103    if (khyt1331_in_use) {
00104       /* return if device already open */
00105       spin_unlock_irq(&khyt1331_lock);
00106       return -EBUSY;
00107    }
00108 
00109    /* mark usage */
00110    khyt1331_in_use = 1;
00111    in_use_pid = current->pid;
00112    interrupt_info = 0;
00113    interrupt_count = 0;
00114    spin_unlock_irq(&khyt1331_lock);
00115 
00116    MOD_INC_USE_COUNT;
00117    return 0;
00118 }
00119 
00120 /*---- close -------------------------------------------------------*/
00121 
00122 static int khyt1331_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *filep)
00123 {
00124    unsigned int minor;
00125 
00126    minor = MINOR(inode->i_rdev);
00127    printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: release called by PID %d, on minor %d\n", current->pid,
00128           minor);
00129 
00130    /* mark device unused */
00131    spin_lock_irq(&khyt1331_lock);
00132    khyt1331_in_use = 0;
00133    spin_unlock_irq(&khyt1331_lock);
00134 
00135    /* remove file from asynchronous readers */
00136    khyt1331_fasync(-1, filep, 0);
00137 
00138    MOD_DEC_USE_COUNT;
00139    return 0;
00140 }
00141 
00142 /*---- interrupt handler -------------------------------------------*/
00143 
00144 void khyt1331_interrupt(int irq, void *dev_id, struct pt_regs *regs)
00145 {
00146    unsigned short adr, i;
00147    unsigned char status, enclam;
00148 
00149    /* figure out which crate caused interrupt */
00150    for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
00151       adr = io_base + (i << 4);
00152       status = INP(adr + 6);
00153       if (status != 0xFF && (status & (1 << 3))) {
00154          enclam = (INP(adr + 8) & 0x1F);        // mask upper 3 bits
00155          interrupt_info = (i << 16) | enclam;
00156 
00157          printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: interrupt crate %d, station %d\n", i, enclam);
00158 
00159          /* disable interrupts */
00160          OUTP(adr + 10, 40);
00161 
00162          /* increment interrupt counter */
00163          interrupt_count++;
00164 
00165          /* wake user process */
00166          wake_up_interruptible(&wq);
00167 
00168          /* send signal to user process */
00169          kill_fasync(&async_queue, SIGIO, POLL_IN);
00170       }
00171    }
00172 
00173    /* signal raw interrupt response time
00174       adr = io_base;
00175       OUTP(adr, 0xFF);
00176       OUTP(adr+8, 1);
00177       OUTP(adr+6, 1);
00178       OUTP(adr+10, 16);
00179       OUTP(adr, 0);
00180       OUTP(adr+10, 16);
00181     */
00182 
00183 }
00184 
00185 /*---- ioctl -------------------------------------------------------*/
00186 
00187 static int khyt1331_ioctl(struct inode *inode, struct file *file,
00188                           unsigned int opcode, unsigned long param)
00189 {
00190    int i, j;
00191    int c, n, a, f, data_size, write_flag, read_flag;
00192    unsigned char status;
00193    unsigned short adr = 0;
00194    unsigned int lam;
00195    CNAF_BUF cnaf_buf;
00196    void *buf;
00197 
00198    // printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: ioctl %d, param  %lX\n", opcode, param);
00199 
00200    switch (opcode) {
00201     /*---- initialization functions --------------------------------*/
00202 
00203    case OP_CRATE_ZINIT:
00204       if (param > 3 || param < 0)
00205          return -EINVAL;
00206 
00207       adr = io_base + (param << 4);
00208       OUTP(adr + 10, 34);
00209       break;
00210 
00211    case OP_CRATE_CLEAR:
00212       if (param > 3 || param < 0)
00213          return -EINVAL;
00214 
00215       adr = io_base + (param << 4);
00216       OUTP(adr + 10, 36);
00217       break;
00218 
00219    case OP_CRATE_CHECK:
00220       if (param > 3 || param < 0)
00221          return -EINVAL;
00222 
00223       adr = io_base + (param << 4);
00224 
00225       /* dummy clear inhibit operation */
00226       OUTP(adr + 8, 1);
00227       OUTP(adr + 6, 2);
00228       OUTP(adr + 10, 32);
00229 
00230       /* readback n, a, f */
00231       a = INP(adr + 10);
00232       n = INP(adr + 10);
00233       f = INP(adr + 10);
00234 
00235       if (n != 1 || a != 2 || f != 32)
00236          return 0;
00237       return 1;
00238 
00239     /*---- normal CAMAC functions ----------------------------------*/
00240 
00241    case OP_CNAF8:
00242    case OP_CNAF16:
00243    case OP_CNAF24:
00244       /*
00245          printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: CNAF: %d %d %d %d %d\n",
00246          cnaf_buf.c, cnaf_buf.n, cnaf_buf.a, cnaf_buf.f, cnaf_buf.d);
00247        */
00248 
00249       if (copy_from_user(&cnaf_buf, (void *) param, sizeof(cnaf_buf)) > 0)
00250          return -EFAULT;
00251 
00252       if (cnaf_buf.c > 3 || cnaf_buf.c < 0)
00253          return -EINVAL;
00254 
00255       adr = io_base + (cnaf_buf.c << 4);
00256 
00257       OUTP(adr + 8, cnaf_buf.n);
00258 
00259       if (cnaf_buf.f >= 8) {
00260          /* write operation */
00261          OUTP(adr, (unsigned char) cnaf_buf.d);
00262          if (opcode != OP_CNAF8) {
00263             OUTP(adr + 2, *(((unsigned char *) &cnaf_buf.d) + 1));
00264             if (opcode == OP_CNAF24)
00265                OUTP(adr + 4, *(((unsigned char *) &cnaf_buf.d) + 2));
00266          }
00267       }
00268       OUTP(adr + 6, cnaf_buf.a);
00269       OUTP(adr + 10, cnaf_buf.f);
00270 
00271       status = (unsigned char) INP(adr + 6);
00272       cnaf_buf.q = status & 1;
00273       cnaf_buf.x = status >> 7;
00274 
00275       if (cnaf_buf.f < 8) {
00276          cnaf_buf.d = 0;
00277          /* read operation */
00278          *((unsigned char *) &cnaf_buf.d) = INP(adr);
00279          if (opcode != OP_CNAF8) {
00280             *(((unsigned char *) &cnaf_buf.d) + 1) = INP(adr + 2);
00281             if (opcode == OP_CNAF24)
00282                *(((unsigned char *) &cnaf_buf.d) + 2) = INP(adr + 4);
00283          }
00284       }
00285 
00286       if (copy_to_user((void *) param, &cnaf_buf, sizeof(cnaf_buf)) > 0)
00287          return -EFAULT;
00288       break;
00289 
00290     /*---- repeat CAMAC functions ----------------------------------*/
00291 
00292    case OP_CNAF8R:
00293    case OP_CNAF16R:
00294    case OP_CNAF24R:
00295 
00296       data_size = opcode == OP_CNAF8R ? 1 : opcode == OP_CNAF16R ? 2 : 4;
00297 
00298       if (copy_from_user(&cnaf_buf, (void *) param, sizeof(cnaf_buf)) > 0)
00299          return -EFAULT;
00300 
00301       printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: CNAFR: %d %d %d %d %lX %d %d\n",
00302              cnaf_buf.c, cnaf_buf.n, cnaf_buf.a, cnaf_buf.f, cnaf_buf.d,
00303              cnaf_buf.r, cnaf_buf.m);
00304 
00305       /* check for valid crate parameter */
00306       if (cnaf_buf.c > 3 || cnaf_buf.c < 0)
00307          return -EINVAL;
00308 
00309       /* check for valid repeat count, allow 1M max. size */
00310       if (cnaf_buf.r < 0 || cnaf_buf.r > 1024 * 1024)
00311          return -EINVAL;
00312 
00313       /* check for valid repeat mode */
00314       if (cnaf_buf.m < RM_COUNT || cnaf_buf.m > RM_NSCAN)
00315          return -EINVAL;
00316 
00317       /* allocate local data buffer */
00318       buf = kmalloc(cnaf_buf.r * data_size, GFP_KERNEL);
00319       if (buf == NULL)
00320          return -ENOMEM;
00321 
00322       read_flag = (cnaf_buf.f < 8);
00323       write_flag = (cnaf_buf.f >= 16 && cnaf_buf.f <= 23);
00324 
00325       if (write_flag) {
00326          /* copy data buffer */
00327          if (copy_from_user(buf, (void *) cnaf_buf.d, cnaf_buf.r * data_size) > 0) {
00328             kfree(buf);
00329             return -EFAULT;
00330          }
00331       }
00332 
00333       /* Turn on the Q-mode for repeat until Q=1 in the INPW(adr+12) */
00334       if (cnaf_buf.m == RM_QMODE)
00335          OUTP(adr + 1, 0x10);
00336 
00337       adr = io_base + (cnaf_buf.c << 4);
00338 
00339       OUTP(adr + 8, cnaf_buf.n);
00340       OUTP(adr + 6, cnaf_buf.a);
00341 
00342       if (write_flag) {
00343          if (data_size == 1) {
00344             OUTP(adr, *((unsigned char *) buf));
00345          } else if (data_size == 2) {
00346             //printk("OUT0: %d\n", *((unsigned short *) buf));
00347             OUTP(adr, *((unsigned char *) buf));
00348             OUTP(adr + 2, *((unsigned char *) buf + 1));
00349          } else if (data_size == 4) {
00350             OUTP(adr, *((unsigned char *) buf));
00351             OUTP(adr + 2, *((unsigned char *) buf + 1));
00352             OUTP(adr + 4, *((unsigned char *) buf + 2));
00353          }
00354       }
00355 
00356       /* trigger first cycle */
00357       OUTP(adr + 10, cnaf_buf.f);
00358 
00359       if (read_flag) {
00360          if (data_size == 1) {
00361             *((unsigned char *) buf) = INP(adr);
00362          } else if (data_size == 2) {
00363             *((unsigned char *) buf) = INP(adr);
00364             *((unsigned char *) buf + 1) = INP(adr + 2);
00365          } else if (data_size == 4) {
00366             *((unsigned char *) buf) = INP(adr);
00367             *((unsigned char *) buf + 1) = INP(adr + 2);
00368             *((unsigned char *) buf + 1) = INP(adr + 4);
00369          }
00370 
00371          /* trigger first cycle */
00372          INPW(adr + 12);
00373          INP(adr + 6);          /* some delay */
00374       }
00375 
00376       /* repeat cycles */
00377       for (i = 1; i < cnaf_buf.r; i++) {
00378          if (write_flag) {
00379             if (data_size == 1) {
00380                OUTPW(adr + 12, *((unsigned char *) buf + i));
00381             } else if (data_size == 2) {
00382                //printk("OUT%d: %d\n", i, *((unsigned short *) buf+i));
00383                OUTPW(adr + 12, *((unsigned short *) buf + i));
00384             } else if (data_size == 4) {
00385                /* write high byte */
00386                OUTP(adr + 4, *((unsigned char *) buf + 4 * i + 2));
00387 
00388                /* write low and middle bytes to repeat register */
00389                OUTPW(adr + 12, *((unsigned short *) buf + 2 * i));
00390             }
00391          }
00392 
00393          if (read_flag) {
00394             if (data_size == 1) {
00395                *((unsigned char *) buf + i) = (unsigned char) INPW(adr + 12);
00396             } else if (data_size == 2) {
00397                *((unsigned short *) buf + i) = INPW(adr + 12);
00398             } else if (data_size == 4) {
00399                /* read high byte */
00400                *((unsigned char *) buf + 4 * i + 2) = INP(adr + 4);
00401 
00402                /* read low and middle bytes from repeat register */
00403                *((unsigned short *) buf + i) = INPW(adr + 12);
00404             }
00405          }
00406 
00407          if (cnaf_buf.m == RM_QMODE) {
00408             /* in Q mode, test FAIL bit in status register */
00409             status = (unsigned char) INP(adr + 6);
00410             if ((status & (1 << 5)) > 0)
00411                break;
00412          }
00413 
00414          if (cnaf_buf.m == RM_ASCAN)
00415             OUTP(adr + 6, ++cnaf_buf.a);
00416 
00417          if (cnaf_buf.m == RM_NSCAN)
00418             OUTP(adr + 8, ++cnaf_buf.n);
00419 
00420          for (j = 0; j < 1000; j++)
00421             udelay(1000);
00422       }
00423 
00424       /* Turn off the Q-mode */
00425       if (cnaf_buf.m == RM_QMODE)
00426          OUTP(adr + 1, 0);
00427 
00428       if (read_flag)
00429          if (copy_to_user((void *) cnaf_buf.d, buf, i * data_size) > 0) {
00430             kfree(buf);
00431             return -EFAULT;
00432          }
00433 
00434       kfree(buf);
00435       break;
00436 
00437    case OP_INHIBIT_SET:
00438       if (param > 3 || param < 0)
00439          return -EINVAL;
00440 
00441       adr = io_base + (param << 4);
00442       OUTP(adr + 10, 33);
00443       break;
00444 
00445    case OP_INHIBIT_CLEAR:
00446       if (param > 3 || param < 0)
00447          return -EINVAL;
00448 
00449       adr = io_base + (param << 4);
00450       OUTP(adr + 10, 32);
00451       break;
00452 
00453    case OP_INHIBIT_TEST:
00454       if (param > 3 || param < 0)
00455          return -EINVAL;
00456 
00457       adr = io_base + (param << 4);
00458       status = INP(adr + 6);
00459       return (status & (1 << 1)) > 0;
00460 
00461    case OP_LAM_ENABLE:
00462       c = param >> 16;
00463       n = param & 0xFF;
00464       if (c > 3 || c < 0 || n > 24 || n < 0)
00465          return -EINVAL;
00466 
00467       adr = io_base + (c << 4);
00468       OUTP(adr + 10, 64 + n);
00469       break;
00470 
00471    case OP_LAM_DISABLE:
00472       c = param >> 16;
00473       n = param & 0xFF;
00474       if (c > 3 || c < 0 || n > 24 || n < 0)
00475          return -EINVAL;
00476 
00477       adr = io_base + (c << 4);
00478       OUTP(adr + 10, 128 + n);
00479       break;
00480 
00481    case OP_LAM_READ:
00482       /*
00483          return a BITWISE coded station NOT the station number
00484          i.e.: n = 5  ==> lam = 0x10
00485        */
00486 
00487       if (param > 3 || param < 0)
00488          return -EINVAL;
00489 
00490       adr = io_base + (param << 4);
00491       status = INP(adr + 6);
00492       if (status & (1 << 3)) {
00493          lam = (INP(adr + 8) & 0x1F);   // mask upper 3 bits
00494          lam = 1 << (lam - 1);
00495       } else
00496          lam = 0;
00497       return lam;
00498 
00499    case OP_LAM_CLEAR:
00500       c = param >> 16;
00501       n = param & 0xFF;
00502       if (c > 3 || c < 0 || n > 24 || n < 0)
00503          return -EINVAL;
00504 
00505       adr = io_base + (c << 4);
00506 
00507       /* restart LAM scanner in controller */
00508       INP(adr + 8);
00509       break;
00510 
00511    case OP_INTERRUPT_ENABLE:
00512       if (param > 3 || param < 0)
00513          return -EINVAL;
00514 
00515       adr = io_base + (param << 4);
00516       OUTP(adr + 10, 41);
00517       break;
00518 
00519    case OP_INTERRUPT_DISABLE:
00520       if (param > 3 || param < 0)
00521          return -EINVAL;
00522 
00523       adr = io_base + (param << 4);
00524       OUTP(adr + 10, 40);
00525       break;
00526 
00527    case OP_INTERRUPT_TEST:
00528       if (param > 3 || param < 0)
00529          return -EINVAL;
00530 
00531       adr = io_base + (param << 4);
00532       status = INP(adr + 6);
00533       return (status & (1 << 2)) > 0;
00534    }
00535 
00536    /* signal success */
00537    return 1;
00538 }
00539 
00540 /*---- read --------------------------------------------------------*/
00541 
00542 int khyt1331_read(struct file *filep, char *buf, size_t count, loff_t * ppos)
00543 {
00544    while (!interrupt_info) {
00545       if (filep->f_flags & O_NONBLOCK)
00546          return -EAGAIN;
00547 
00548       if (signal_pending(current))
00549          return -ERESTARTSYS;
00550 
00551       interruptible_sleep_on(&wq);
00552    }
00553 
00554    copy_to_user(buf, &interrupt_info, 4);
00555    interrupt_info = 0;
00556    return 4;
00557 }
00558 
00559 /*---- poll --------------------------------------------------------*/
00560 
00561 unsigned int khyt1331_poll(struct file *filep, poll_table * wait)
00562 {
00563    poll_wait(filep, &wq, wait);
00564 
00565    if (interrupt_info)
00566       return POLLIN | POLLRDNORM;
00567 
00568    return 0;
00569 }
00570 
00571 /*---- fasync ------------------------------------------------------*/
00572 
00573 int khyt1331_fasync(int fd, struct file *filep, int mode)
00574 {
00575    printk("khyt1331: fasync %d\n", mode);
00576    return fasync_helper(fd, filep, mode, &async_queue);
00577 }
00578 
00579 /*---- info rovided for /proc/khyt1331 interface -------------------*/
00580 
00581 int khyt1331_read_procmem(char *buf, char **start, off_t offset, int count,
00582                           int *eof, void *data)
00583 {
00584    int i, len;
00585 
00586    if (io_base) {
00587       len =
00588           sprintf(buf, "Hytec 5331 card found at address 0x%X, using interrupt %d\n",
00589                   io_base, irq);
00590 
00591       if (khyt1331_in_use)
00592          len += sprintf(buf + len, "Device in use by process with PID %d\n", in_use_pid);
00593       else
00594          len += sprintf(buf + len, "Device not in use\n");
00595 
00596       if (!khyt1331_in_use) {
00597          for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
00598             len += sprintf(buf + len, "CAMAC crate %d: %s\n", i,
00599                            khyt1331_ioctl(NULL, NULL, OP_CRATE_CHECK, i) ?
00600                            "responding" : "not responding");
00601       } else
00602          len += sprintf(buf + len, "Received %d interrupts\n", interrupt_count);
00603    } else
00604       len = sprintf(buf, "No Hytec 5331 card found\n");
00605 
00606    *eof = 1;
00607    return len;
00608 }
00609 
00610 /*---- jump table for direcio operations ---------------------------*/
00611 
00612 static struct file_operations khyt1331_fops = {
00613    ioctl:&khyt1331_ioctl,
00614    open:&khyt1331_open,
00615    read:&khyt1331_read,
00616    poll:&khyt1331_poll,
00617    release:&khyt1331_release,
00618    fasync:&khyt1331_fasync,
00619 };
00620 
00621 /*---- init_module -------------------------------------------------*/
00622 
00623 int init_module(void)
00624 {
00625    struct pci_dev *dev;
00626    int err;
00627 
00628    printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: start initialization\n");
00629 
00630    if (register_chrdev(HYT1331_MAJOR, "hyt1331", &khyt1331_fops)) {
00631       printk(KERN_ERR "khyt1331: unable to get major %d\n", HYT1331_MAJOR);
00632       return -EBUSY;
00633    }
00634 
00635    /* PCI scan */
00636    dev = NULL;
00637    dev = pci_find_device(0x1196, 0x5331, dev);
00638    if (dev != NULL) {
00639       io_base = pci_resource_start(dev, 3);
00640       irq = dev->irq;
00641       printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: Found 5331 card at %X, irq %d\n", io_base, irq);
00642 
00643       /* request IO ports */
00644 
00645       if ((err = check_region(io_base, 0x40)) < 0) {
00646          printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: Cannot request IO address %X\n", io_base);
00647          return err;
00648       }
00649 
00650       request_region(io_base, 0x40, "khyt1331");
00651 
00652       /* request interrupt */
00653       if (request_irq(irq, khyt1331_interrupt, SA_SHIRQ, "khyt1331", &khyt1331_fops)) {
00654          printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: Cannot request interrupt %d\n", irq);
00655          irq = -1;
00656       }
00657    } else {
00658       printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: No 5331 card found\n");
00659       return -ENODEV;
00660    }
00661 
00662    /* register /proc/khyt1331 interface */
00663    create_proc_read_entry("khyt1331", 0, NULL, khyt1331_read_procmem, NULL);
00664 
00665    printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: initialization finished\n");
00666 
00667    return 0;
00668 }
00669 
00670 /*---- cleanup_module ----------------------------------------------*/
00671 
00672 void cleanup_module(void)
00673 {
00674    release_region(io_base, 0x40);
00675 
00676    if (irq > 0)
00677       free_irq(irq, &khyt1331_fops);
00678 
00679    if (unregister_chrdev(HYT1331_MAJOR, "hyt1331"))
00680       printk(KERN_ERR "khyt1331: can't unregister device\n");
00681 
00682    remove_proc_entry("khyt1331", NULL);
00683 
00684    printk(KERN_INFO "khyt1331: driver removed\n");
00685 }
